page.title: 15Toftcarl Water Filter Plant
page.content: Toftcarl filter station overlooks the town of Wick which it has been supply- ing with water since 1883.The source of water is Loch Yarrows which lies 5.1km.to the south.Its catchment area is the uncultivated hilly ground, con- sisting of heather clad peat soil and giving the water its acid content. The water is gravity fed from Loch to filter station to town. The first stage of purification is the addition of two expensive chemicals: Aluminium Sulphate and Magnafloc which cause the formation of sludge-disposed of in Hempriggs loch!! Next is the addition of Chlorine as a sterilising agent and Lime as a Ph. adjuster and finally filtration through sand.Then storage in an underground reservoir. Town consumption is recorded daily. Thrumster is supplied from Loch Calder
